feature.name: Divine Domain: Feast Domain (HB)
feature.text:
Clerics of the Feast domain may be a ravenous individual out to consume or a humble acolyte who grew up in poverty, vowing to never let anyone go hungry again. Deities who welcome practitioners of the Feast domain are Shomorrah, Obad-Hai, Hiddukel, the Devourer, and Laogzed. Deities from histrical pantheons who are open to the Feast domain include the Daghdha, Dionysus, Isis, and Ulfer.
Domain Spells: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Feast Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.
Feast Domain Spells: Cleric Level | Spells 1st | goodberry, purify food and drink 3rd | Melf's acid arrow, protection from poison 5th | create food and water, plant growth 7th | blight, compulsion 9th | heroes' feast*, insect plague
* Can be cast as a 5th level spell using a 5th level slot.
Source: Remley Farr - The Fasting Worm at the Spider Feast (Homebrew)

feature.name: Bonus Cantrip (Feast Domain (HB))
feature.text:
When you choose this domain at 1st level, you learn the acid splash cantrip if you don't already know it. Even though it doesn't appear on the cleric spell list, the spell is nonetheless a cleric spell for you.
Source: Remley Farr - The Fasting Worm at the Spider Feast (Homebrew)

feature.name: Bolster Immunities (Feast Domain (HB))
feature.text:
Beginning at 1st level, you can bolster your allies' immunities against certain effects. When you or an ally within 30 feet of you have to make a Constitution save, you can use your reaction to give advantage to the saving throw. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum once) per day. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Source: Remley Farr - The Fasting Worm at the Spider Feast (Homebrew)

feature.name: Channel Divinity: Satiate the Masses (Feast Domain (HB))
feature.text:
Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to end hunger in one creature for a day, whether it's a raging bulette devouring a cornfield or a poor child in need of a meal. As an action, target a creature you can touch. That creature must succeed on a Constitution save equal to your spell save DC or else no longer need to eat for 24 hours (and obtaining all benefits of being fed). This save cannot be failed voluntarily.
Source: Remley Farr - The Fasting Worm at the Spider Feast (Homebrew)

feature.name: Gastric Acid (Feast Domain (HB))
feature.text:
At 6th level, when you deal acid damage with a spell or weapon attack, the acid breaks down the creature's flesh into digestible material that you can magically assimilate into your body or an ally's body. For every 10 points of acid damage that you deal to a living creature, you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you gains 1d6 temporary hit points for 1 hour. Temporary hit points gained this way cannot exceed twice your cleric level per individual.
Source: Remley Farr - The Fasting Worm at the Spider Feast (Homebrew)

feature.name: Divine Strike (Feast Domain (HB))
feature.text:
You gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 acid damage. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.
Source: Remley Farr - The Fasting Worm at the Spider Feast (Homebrew)

feature.name: Communion (Feast Domain (HB))
feature.text:
When spending hit dice to regain hit points during a short rest, you and anyone who eats a meal prepared by you during the short rest recover twice the amount of hit points instead of the regular amount.
Source: Remley Farr - The Fasting Worm at the Spider Feast (Homebrew)
